snippet: A unanimous panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit found that the legislation had been directed at preventing mass shootings like that in Newtown, Conn., in 2012.
abstract: Federal appeals court upholds bans on assault weapons and large-capacity magazines passed in New York and Connecticut following 2012 massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary school; decision holds states' bans do not violate second amendment.
lead_paragraph: A unanimous panel of the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit found that the legislation had been directed at preventing mass shootings like that in Newtown, Conn., in 2012.

headline.main: Bans on Assault Weapons in New York and Connecticut Are Upheld
